subject: Art & Design
title: Cognitive Load: Don't Overwhelm the Brain
description: A quick win: understand Cognitive Load: Don't Overwhelm the Brain.

hook.text: You open a website and see 50 buttons, 3 pop-ups, and flashing banners. Your brain says: leave. Immediately.

buildup.text: Cognitive load is the total mental effort required to use a product. High load = frustration and errors.

discovery.text: Working memory holds about 4 items at once. Exceed that, and users start forgetting, making mistakes, and quitting.

twist.text: Simplicity isn't about fewer features. It's about progressive disclosure: reveal complexity only when users need it.

climax.text: Google's homepage is one search bar. Yet Google is the most complex product in the world. Complexity is hidden.

punchline.text: Great design doesn't make users think less. It makes thinking effortless.

quiz.question: What is 'progressive disclosure' in design?
options: Revealing complexity gradually, only when users need it
Showing all features at once for transparency
Slowly loading content to improve performance
